fast3d.graphics

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.math.Vector4d
      • fast3d.graphics.Color

  • public class Color
extends Vector4d
    a color in 3d-space is represented by 4 values: r(red),g(green),b(blue) and alpha(transparency) in the rgba-model, but the values of r,g,b and alpha have to in the interval [0d,1d]
    used for lighting and general coloring in a 3d-graphics-context
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class fast3d.math.Vector4d

        a, x, y, z

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Color(double r, double g, double b)
      constructs a color-model, r,g and b in [0d,1d]
      the alpha component will be 1d (opaque)
      Color(double r, double g, double b, double a)
      constructs a color-model, r,g,b and a in [0d,1d]
      an alpha value of 1 means opaque and 0 means transparent
      Color(Vector4d res)
      constructs a color-model, r,g,b,a as declared by x,y,z,a in the given vector3d

      • awtColorOpaque

        public java.awt.Color awtColorOpaque()
        Returns:
        the abstract window toolkit form of this color, but ignoring the alpha component (usable to draw this color to a JButton preventing artifacts)

      • invert

        public Color invert()
        inverts the rgb-range
        the inverted value of any rgb-value is ( 1 - value )
        alpha will be constant
        Overrides:
        invert in class Vector4d
        Returns:
        a this-reference
